thread.title: Hot wheels! Daring mountain bikers cycle down active volcanoes in Sicily and bunny hop on smouldering rocks and oozing lava
thread.title_full: Hot wheels! Daring mountain bikers cycle down active volcanoes in Sicily and bunny hop on smouldering rocks and oozing lava | Daily Mail Online

author: Jake Polden For Mailonline
title: Hot wheels! Daring mountain bikers cycle down active volcanoes in Sicily and bunny hop on smouldering rocks and oozing lava
text:
View
comments
As far as extreme sports go mountain biking is generally considered to be a safer and more conservative option.
But a pair of biking enthusiasts have turned that reputation on its head by cycling over the rugged terrain of active volcanoes in Sicily.
The duo recorded their epic descent on cameras mounted to their helmets, while a third person filmed them from afar.
Explosive downhill bike riding over active volcanoes in Sicily The pair of daring mountain bikers cycled over the rugged and hot terrain of active volcanoes in Sicily
The duo recorded their epic descent on cameras mounted to their helmets, while a third person filmed them from afar
Stromboli island volcano pictured during eruptive activity in 2007
This stunning picture shows Mount Etna erupting in 2002, an event that sent rivers of lava streaming down the mountainside
In the video the pair can be seen negotiating the hot and jagged terrain of the Stromboli, Vulcano and Etna volcanoes with relative ease.
They cycle past smouldering rocks and the summit of one of the volcanoes, which spits lava at them.
 Next Don't mind me! Stunned tourists look on as elephant wanders... They like to moo-ve it! Commuter films hilarious footage of... Ruff treatment! Huge dog left with tail between its legs... Adorable video captures English bulldog Khaleesi watching... They even bunny hop while moving quickly on the bleak terrain.
Later in the clip the duo can be seen walking on the mountain alongside their bikes â€“ the bike's tyres appear to hold up well against the heat of the mountain.
The duo negotiated the hot and jagged terrain of the Stromboli, Vulcano and Etna volcanoes with relative ease
The bikers cycled past smouldering rocks and the summit of one of the volcanoes, which spat lava at them
The video concludes with one of the mountain bikers cycling off down the volcano and into the sunset.
Mount Etna is the tallest volcano in Europe and produces regular low-level eruptions.
It stands at a height of 10,922ft, covers an area of 459 square miles and has a basal circumference of 87 miles.
Vulcano and Stromboli are also active volcanoes, and the latter has been in an almost continuous state of eruption for the past 2,000 years.
The pair cycled on Mount Etna, which is the tallest volcano in Europe and produces regular low-level eruptions
The pair also cycled on Vulcano and Stromboli, which are active volcanoes that produce low-level eruptions
